MWGF is open to the public and executed by its secretariat appointed by UNFPA.

projects.name: Promote Innovation & Youth Engagement in Climate & Environmental Action
projects.description:
1) Promote innovation and build capacity of youth in addressing climate change, environmental and disaster challenges affecting children 
2) Support the Environment Protection Department Sabah in implementing a pilot air quality monitoring system in schools in Sabah with close involvement of young people
3) Building capacity and networks of youth and identification of youth champions in support of youth engagement in climate action and environmental sustainability 
4)  Climate & Youth Consultant
projects.outcome: Preparedness and resilience (especially of indigenous, poor, at-risk communities) against climate change, natural hazards, and disaster risks are strengthened.

projects.name: Strengthen National Systems & Build National Capacity for the Protection of Children Affected by Migration
projects.description:
Focus on Child Immigration Detention through:
a) Mapping of children's pathways in and out of immigration detention (2022 - to be finalised 2023) [mapping already paid under CF contract last year, new immigration law consultant to be contracted]
b)  Continous technical support for alternative to immigration detention (ATD) pilot and evaluation of ATD pilot. [Placeholder - no budget allocated as ATD pilot stalled, dependent on government progress]
c) Development of advocacy strategy on ATD, with
projects.outcome: Institutions are more capable of undertaking inclusive political processes and are more citizen-centric and protective of fundamental freedoms.

projects.name: Institutional capacity of state of Melaka enhanced to enable Melaka as a sustainable city (Sustainable City Development in Malaysia)
projects.description:
The project, Sustainable City Development in Malaysia, aims i) promote an integrated approach to urban planning and management that is guided by an evidence-based, multi-dimensional, and broadly inclusive planning process that balances economic, social, and environmental resource consideration; and 2. To build awareness and institutional capacity, and promote investment in climate risks mitigation technologies through demonstration projects.

projects.outcome: Competitive, sustainable and inclusive urban development that supports social and economic well-being for the population.

projects.name: Support PrEP Implementation and Expansion
projects.description: Laying the groundwork for the implementation of Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) among key populations in Malaysia. This project seeks to explore perceptions and concerns regarding PrEP across relevant stakeholders, thus laying the groundwork to support the actual implementation of various PrEP when it is available in Malaysia in the future. Activity will include workshops and/or capacity-building training among key populations in relation to PrEP whereby the input is poised to exert a profound i
projects.outcome: Social services are strengthened to ensure universal access to high-quality, equity focused social services that promote social wellbeing for all.
